alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 5:04AM AKST until January 07 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON AKST SUNDAY FROM SLEETMUTE TO CROOKED CREEK... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Lower Kuskokwim Valley from Sleetmute to Crooked Creek, including the communities of Red Devil and Georgetown. * WHEN...From noon today to noon AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A long duration of light to moderate snow is expected as a front stalls out over Southwest Alaska this weekend. Temperatures are expected to be near freezing, leading to wet and heavy snow. There is a chance that rain could mix with snow, which could lead to lower snow amounts.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
